response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). In a large mixing bowl, whisk together 2 ½ cups all‑purpose flour, 2 ½ teaspoons baking powder, ½ teaspoon baking soda, and ¾ teaspoon salt. In a separate bowl, sift 1 ¾ cups granulated sugar, ¾ cup unsweetened cocoa powder, and 1 ½ teaspoons espresso powder for depth.",
  "step2": "In another bowl, combine 1 cup buttermilk, ½ cup warm water, ¼ cup vegetable oil, and 2 large eggs at room temperature. Whisk until smooth, then stir in 2 teaspoons vanilla extract. Gradually add the dry ingredients, mixing gently to avoid over‑development of gluten, creating a thick batter.",
  "step3": "Melt ½ cup unsalted butter and ½ cup dark chocolate together over a simmering pot, stirring until glossy. Allow to cool slightly, then fold the chocolate mixture into the batter, ensuring an even swirl without deflating the batter. This adds richness and a deep chocolate flavor.",
  "step4": "Grease three 8‑inch round cake pans with butter and line with parchment circles. Divide the batter evenly among the pans, smoothing the tops with a spatula. Tap pans gently on the counter to release any trapped air bubbles, promoting an even crumb structure.",
  "step5": "Bake for 25‑30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center emerges clean with a few moist crumbs. Rotate pans halfway for uniform baking. Remove from oven, let cool in pans for 10 minutes, then invert onto wire racks to cool completely.",
  "step6": "Prepare a chocolate ganache by heating 1 cup heavy cream to a simmer, then pouring over 8 oz chopped semi‑sweet chocolate. Stir until smooth, let thicken slightly, and spread between cake layers. Frost the exterior, garnish with chocolate shavings, and serve eight generous slices."
}
